summary: The Secretary-General of the United Nations is like the boss of the UN organization. They are in charge of the UN's day-to-day work and lead an important team called the Secretariat. This role is described in the UN's rule book, the United Nations Charter. However, some details about the job, like who can be the Secretary-General and how long they can stay, are not clearly written down and have become customs over time.
title: Secretary-General of the United Nations
